posts.content:
Hi all

Any idea what this is worth?

The cooker looks very much like a Canterbury Pitt one, but without the mechanism to make it flip out of a door cupboard. It obviously has some legs to make it a table top version instead. Are those corner legs removable? If so I think it would be worth a lot more to a CP owner.

Just a quick edit to the above point...
I now see (from older posts) that you've already got a CP cupboard. The cooker does look to be correct for a CP but you may need someone to make you up the brackets that would make if fold with the cupboard. I also see that someone says its correct for a Devon too... I didn't know that!

Personally in your position I'd try to make it work with the CP. They are definitely the best splitty cookers (in my experience) and you look like you are 90% of the way there.

Other than that I'm sorry but I don't know its value. CP door cookers (with cupboard) seem to go for between £300 - £400 ish if that helps?!?!?

I answered the question you asked....but I would also try to work out if you can copy or make some brackets or supports so it will pack away in your cupboard.
I am sure I have seen one if these Atlas New World cookers on fold away mode..
G
